newsitem.title: FRANCE: Soc Gen says surprised at Paribas report.
newsitem.headline: Soc Gen says surprised at Paribas report.

text.p: French bank Societe Generale said on Thursday it was "surprised" by a newspaper report saying it was considering an alliance with financial holding company Paribas.

Financial daily La Tribune on Thursday quoted Societe Generale chairman Marc Vienot as saying it "would be more logical for a bank like ours to get together with a French investment bank such as Paribas".
A Societe Generale spokesman said the bank was "surprised" at the newspaper report, but made no further immediate comment.
A Paribas spokesman denied that it might consider a link-up with Societe Generale.
"Paribas reaffirms what it said during the presentation of its results. A Franco-French link-up is of no interest to Paribas."
He reiterated Paribas' main strategy was to seek internal development while also considering acquisitions abroad.
